page.title: 04Silage making,Marchwood
page.content: In our area the main type of agriculture is dairy farming.Lots of fields are used for pasture which provides grazing in summer and silage and hay for winter feed.{Silage is {better for cows} because it is more nutritious and produces better quality milk. {To make silage}the grass is cut while it is still green in late spring and summer.It is stored under sheets of black polythene...the black absorbs the sun's heat better.Natural sugar in the grass helps to preserve it and the grass is turned into a brown sticky substance with a strong sweet smell which is familiar in the country lanes around Marchwood. Old motor car tyres are put on top the polythene to stop it blowing away.In a good summer three cuts of grass are made.
